sentences: Kamaljit Singh Jhooti (born 26 March 1981), better known by the stage name Jay Sean, is an English singer, songwriter, record producer and arranger.

== Life and career ==

sentences: Life and career ==
section: == Life and career ==
== Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Early life and career beginnings ===
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Jay Sean was born as Kamaljit Singh Jhooti (Hindi: कमलजीत सिंह झूटी; Punjabi: ਕਮਲਜੀਤ ਸਿੰਘ ਝੂਤੀ) on March 26th, 1981 in Hounslow, West London into an Indian Punjabi Sikh family to parents Sharan Singh Jhooti and Bindi Kaur Jhooti.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He was raised in Southall, West London and displayed musical talent at an early age.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: At age 11, he and his cousin Pritpal Rupra formed a hip hop duo named "Compulsive Disorder".
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: His stage name at the time was MC "Nicky J", with the "J" being derived from the first letter of his last name "Jhooti".
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He eventually came to be known by the nickname "Jay" among his friends.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He was a student at Latymer Upper School, the same private school that Hugh Grant, Heston Blumenthal and Lily Cole had attended.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He left the school in 1997.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He finished his GCSEs as a "straight-A student" and then completed his A Levels with an A grade in Biology and B grades in Mathematics and Chemistry.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He later enrolled in Barts and The London School of Medicine and Dentistry at Queen Mary University of London, to study Medicine before he dropped out in 2003 to pursue a singing career.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: For his music career, he chose the stage name Jay Sean; "Jay" being his nickname, while "Sean" is derived from "Shaan"—a nickname he was called at home by his grandmother—which means "shining star" or "pride" in the Punjabi language.
section: == Life and career == | === Early life and career beginnings ===
== Life and career == | === 2003–2006: Me Against Myself with Relentless Records ===
== Life and career == | === 2003–2006: Me Against Myself with Relentless Records ===

sentences: Me Against Myself with Relentless Records =
section: == Life and career == | === 2003–2006: Me Against Myself with Relentless Records ===
== Life and career == | === 2003–2006: Me Against Myself with Relentless Records ===

sentences: After Sean's track "One Minute" fell into the hands of producer Rishi Rich, the Rishi Rich Project was formed (consisting of Rich, Sean and Juggy D) in 2003.
section: == Life and career == | === 2003–2006: Me Against Myself with Relentless Records ===

sentences: Their first taste of UK chart success was the Asian underground song, "Dance with You (Nachna Tere Naal)", which became a Top 20 hit, peaking at #12.
section: == Life and career == | === 2003–2006: Me Against Myself with Relentless Records ===

sentences: This led to Sean signing a £1m deal with Virgin Records, under their label Relentless Records.
section: == Life and career == | === 2003–2006: Me Against Myself with Relentless Records ===

sentences: His second single, "Eyes on You", was his first solo effort and became a Top 10 hit, peaking at #6.
section: == Life and career == | === 2003–2006: Me Against Myself with Relentless Records ===

sentences: His third single, "Stolen", peaked at #4, with Bollywood actress Bipasha Basu making an appearance in the video.
section: == Life and career == | === 2003–2006: Me Against Myself with Relentless Records ===

sentences: His debut album, Me Against Myself, was released in 2004 and received much critical praise and acclaim.
section: == Life and career == | === 2003–2006: Me Against Myself with Relentless Records ===

sentences: Sean was referred to as an "Asian sensation" and was praised for his experimental, creative fusion of contemporary R&B, British hip hop and Indian music.
section: == Life and career == | === 2003–2006: Me Against Myself with Relentless Records ===

sentences: The title track in particular was considered innovative, featuring two alter egos of himself, one an R&B singer and the other a rapper, clashing in a rap battle.
section: == Life and career == | === 2003–2006: Me Against Myself with Relentless Records ===

sentences: Despite initially failing to reach the top 20 on the UK Albums Chart (where it peaked at #29), the album gradually managed to sell 100,000 copies in the UK and went on to become a substantial hit in India, selling over two million copies there.
section: == Life and career == | === 2003–2006: Me Against Myself with Relentless Records ===

sentences: He made a brief appearance in the 2005 Bollywood film Kyaa Kool Hai Hum, providing the song "Dil Mera (My Heart)" to the soundtrack, based on "One Night" from his own debut album.
section: == Life and career == | === 2003–2006: Me Against Myself with Relentless Records ===

sentences: Beyond India, the album sold over 300,000 copies across other parts of the world, including Europe, the Middle East, Southeast Asia, and Hong Kong.
section: == Life and career == | === 2003–2006: Me Against Myself with Relentless Records ===

sentences: His performance of tracks from Me Against Myself on MTV Asia (alongside the Rishi Rich Project) had a television audience as large as 165 million viewers.
section: == Life and career == | === 2003–2006: Me Against Myself with Relentless Records ===

sentences: It helped establish Sean as a major recognised artist across Asia and among the worldwide Desi diaspora, and remains his most successful album to date.
section: == Life and career == | === 2003–2006: Me Against Myself with Relentless Records ===

sentences: With his debut album, Sean was influential in popularising Indian-R&B fusion sounds in Asian underground and Indian pop music.
section: == Life and career == | === 2003–2006: Me Against Myself with Relentless Records ===

sentences: He recorded a 16 track album which was scrapped because Virgin felt the market had changed to where it was all about Pop music.
section: == Life and career == | === 2003–2006: Me Against Myself with Relentless Records ===

sentences: In February 2006, after several delays of his second album, he left Virgin Records.
section: == Life and career == | === 2003–2006: Me Against Myself with Relentless Records ===
== Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===
== Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: After parting ways with Virgin Records, Sean continued to work on his second album, which was initially named after the title track "Deal With It", but the song ended up being given to Corbin Bleu.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: Sean's background vocals remain on Bleu's version of the track.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: The song "Deal With It" earned Sean a BMI Songwriter Award and later inspired the 2009 single "Juliette" by South Korean band Shinee.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: Sean returned in late 2007 with the new single "Ride It", which was the first single from his second album My Own Way.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: It was to be the first album released as a joint-venture between his own label Jayded and 2Point9 Records.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: The video for "Ride It", released in early 2008, featured Sean with a new style after being out of the limelight for nearly three and a half years.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: My Own Way debuted at No. 6 in the official UK Albums Chart and generated two more UK top 20 singles, "Ride It" and "Maybe".
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: On the back of this Sean received two MOBO Award nominations, for Best UK Male (alongside Dizzee Rascal, Taio Cruz, Wiley and Sway) and Best R'n'B/
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: Soul (alongside Usher, Estelle, Ne-Yo and Chris Brown).
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: "Ride It" was successful in Eastern Europe, especially in Russia, Turkey and Romania, where it became one of the three best-selling singles of the year.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: The song was remixed by Kosovan DJ Regard in 2019 and became a viral hit on the TikTok app.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: "Maybe" was his most successful single in Japan, where it reached No. 7 on the Japan Hot 100 Singles.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: A Mandarin Chinese cover version of "Maybe" by Coco Lee has been released in China.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: Sean sang a Hindi version of the album My Own Way for release in India.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: The album sold more than 350,000 copies across the world.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: Touch Magazine in the UK described him as "the UK's answer to Ne-Yo," while The Independent called him "...an urban legend in the making."
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: In August 2008, Sean co-hosted London radio station Choice FM's Breakfast show a week in which he only performed previously unheard tracks, including a song whose title was left to the listeners to decide.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: The unknown track was later confirmed to be called "Tonight" and is included in My Own Way: Deluxe Edition.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: Sean was confirmed for the third series of Celebrity Scissorhands in October 2008 but he withdrew before the show was aired for unclear reasons.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: On 15 October 2008 during the MOBO Awards, Sean announced that he had signed with the
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: American hip-hop oriented record label Cash Money Records distributed via Universal Republic Records making him the first male British Asian singer to sign with an American label.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: His American-debut single was "Down" featuring American rapper and label mate Lil Wayne.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: It topped the Billboard Hot 100, replacing The Black Eyed Peas.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: This made him the first British artist to top the Hot 100 since Freddie Mercury of Queen in 1980, and the first solo artist of Asian descent to do so.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: "Down" has sold more than six million copies in the United States, and three million digital copies in the US, making the song the best-selling single by a British/European male artist in North America since Elton John's "Candle in the Wind" in 1997.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: In addition, "Down" has received a large airplay of two billion listener impressions on radio worldwide.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: As of November 2011, "Down" has sold 4.1 million copies in the US, which is currently the fifth best-selling song by a British artist in the digital era.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: In November 2009, Sean's next single from his album, "Do You Remember", was released and featured Jamaican dancehall superstar Sean Paul plus US Southern crunk rapper Lil Jon.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: It entered the Hot 100 top ten on the week of 9 January 2009, breaking "a three-week streak of no titles moving into the top 10" since December 2009.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: Like its predecessor, it has sold more than a million copies in the United States.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: At the 2009 UK Asian Music Awards (AMA), Sean won three awards, including "Best Male", "Best Urban Act" and "Best Album", the latter for his second album, My Own Way.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: He met with Rishi Rich, Juggy D and H-Dhami during the ceremony.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: After the award, he was in America for the first time since signing with Cash Money, he announced through an interview with MTV IGGY that he was recording five new songs for his album, then titled My Own Way (U.S. edition), one of which was his American-debut single with Lil Wayne, later titled "Down".
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: Sean discussed a collaboration with Akon at the 2009 Grammy Awards, in addition to recording a song with Nadine Coyle and told viewers that the album will be released in third quarter of 2009.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: The album title was later changed to All or Nothing, and featured brand new songs and some of the songs from My Own Way.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: Despite success with two singles from the album, the album itself only debuted at No. 37 on the US Billboard 200.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: It was his lowest-charting entry on the UK Albums Chart, debuting there at #62.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: Despite this, it has become his highest-charting album in Japan, reaching No. 11 on the Oricon Albums Chart.

sentences: Sean was featured on a song called "Written on Her" alongside Birdman for the CEO's project, released on 23 June 2009 on iTunes.

sentences: Sean has featured on Skepta's single "Lush" released on 10 June 2009 on iTunes.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: On 2 February 2010, Kevin Rudolf's single "I Made It (Cash Money Heroes)", featured Sean alongside Birdman and Lil Wayne, was released.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: In early December 2009, it was confirmed that he has collaborated with Justin Timberlake and Esmée Denters on a song, "Love Dealer".
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: There have been talks of collaborations with other American artists such as Ashley Tisdale, Taylor Swift, Nicole Scherzinger, Rihanna, Usher, and Jay-Z & Beyoncé.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: Sean was in early September 2009 nominated for the 30 Under 30 award.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: At the 2009 UK Urban Music Awards, he won the Best Collaboration award for "Down" alongside Lil Wayne.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: In early December 2009, he was ranked No. 35 in Billboard's Hot 100 Artists of the year.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2009: My Own Way and All or Nothing ===

sentences: Sean's performance "had the entire crowd – parents and children, teens and twenty-somethings – dancing."

section: == Community work ==

sentences: During this time, he also visited different UK schools to inspire and encourage schoolchildren to get involved in music; at one school, he met a young Zayn Malik and encouraged him to sing on stage for the first time.

sentences: It became one of the highest-earning charity events of the year, raising more than $9 million.
section: == Community work ==

sentences: In 2012, Sean became a part of Child Hunger Ends Here campaign along with artists Owl City and Jewel.

sentences: For this purpose he recorded a song named "Here's Hope" which was available from the Child Hunger Ends Here website.

sentences: He also appeared in a PETA ad campaign, encouraging potential pet owners to adopt from shelters rather than buy from stores.
